intro: Trikeraia pappiformis, commonly known as the silky trikeraia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branched stems covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Trikeraia pappiformis is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
